text: 20:18 is in the books and it has been
the best year yet for my personal growth
goals and travels in 2018 Deanna and I
stepped foot on our seventh continent
together we made Bangkok our new home
base and we successfully held our first
group trip I cracked both one and two
million social media followers and 500
million overall video views
I hired a full-time cinematographer
Michael Welch who has taken my video
production to a whole new level
[Music]
throughout this year I visited 41
countries 35 of them were for the first
time including 24 countries in Africa
I'm getting culture here in Equatorial
Guinea almost half of the continent 2018
has truly been a year for the books as
I've had thousands of amazing memories
and new friendships but if I have to
narrow it down the following are my top
10 experiences of 2018 one esfahan Iran
I cannot tell you how much I've fallen
in love with Iran after spending two
weeks there it's the most misconceived
country in the world the most enjoyable
city for me was Isfahan home to the
world's second biggest city square an
amazing architecture to Somaliland
another underrated country is Somalia
which I visited the sovereign northern
state of Somaliland for five days the
capital of Hargeisa was filled with life
markets and delicious food we are
walking around some markets right now
but the best part was the camel market 3
the Omo Valley in Ethiopia I went to the
Omo Valley in the southwestern part to
visit the most remote tribes in Africa
the nomadic mercy tribe was fascinating
with their lip plates and headwear
we went to their local market goats and
sheep and cows they are selling here and
it was absolutely surreal to witness for
Uganda primates in Uganda I visited both
the mountain gorillas and the
chimpanzees in their natural habitat
once-in-a-lifetime experience it was
amazing to observe how similar we are to
them as humans share 99% of their DNA 5
a Syrian refugee camp while in Lebanon I
wanted to visit a few families of the
million Syrian refugees who escaped war
to settle over the border I was welcomed
with tea coffee and smiles inside of
their tent homes as I interviewed
various families they are such humble
people and I cannot wait to go to Syria
soon 6 Maldives birthday for my 27th
birthday Deanna and I had an incredible
time in the Maldives we first stood on a
resort island but then I wanted to see
the local life which not many people get
to experience so we headed to an island
called Mapuche it was Ramadan and I
enjoyed spending it with my local
friends and their family
I want to take this back to my country
and show people seven Bhutan Tiger's
Nest Bhutan surprised me in many ways
such as their initiative to protect the
environment and unbelievably warm people
but nothing was more impressive than the
hike to Tiger's Nest
and the Jews here are absolutely
stunning that giant mystical monastery
built on the side of a cliff Tiger's
Nest is one of the very important and
sacred place in Bhutan and it's a normal
purchase for all the Buddhists to come
here because this is a very important
site eight Gabon iboga in this Central
African nation I did an initiation for
iboga the psychedelic drug that's found
in the local tree bark so it's all
pretty much resident in this circle down
there yeah right down to I didn't take
enough to feel any effect but I did all
the rituals and it was out of this world
nine Namibian road trip overall I think
Namibia is my favourite country in
Africa it's a place for glistening sand
dunes meet with the blue ocean wildlife
is everywhere and so are nomadic tribes
I spent an afternoon with the Himba
people oh man this is culture learning
about their way of life hello
they are so friendly ten Mauritius
nature we spent nine days in this island
nation of the southeastern coast of
Africa and the nature was breathtaking
high waterfalls luscious greenery
perfect beaches and scuba diving I
highly recommend it 2018 was a really
special year for me all around and I'm
really sad that it's over I hope you
guys can see the common theme from my
highlights that all human beings are
kind and hospitable even when I travel
to the farthest places away from home
I am constantly surprised and humbled by
the people I meet I just wanted to
extend another thank you guys so much
for watching my videos it really means
the world to me
2019 will hopefully be the year that I
finished all the countries in the world
it's gonna be an amazing ride and stay
tuned because I promise you that the
best is yet to come
I'm drew pinsky and if you like my
travel videos please click Subscribe and
join me as I plan to visit every country
in the world
